availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Cannon (Louisville, Kentucky, millinery merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, millinery merchant. Pennsylvania native. Millinery merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, from 1855 to 1856. Millinery merchant in partnership with William L. McCampbell in Louisville from 1857 to 1860. Millinery merchant in partnership with William H. Byers in Louisville from 1860 to 1865. Charged with burglary against Jones & Tapp clothing store in Louisville in December 1864 with George W. Connell, George Watson, and Frank Winters. Fugitive from justice in Tennessee in 1864. Convicted of burglary in Louisville on January 19, 1865.
